intro: Rosa rubiginosa f. eriocalyx, commonly known as the rough-stemmed dog玫瑰, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces edible hips, which are rich in vitamin C and often used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
